Caption: Eni one of the world s biggest polluters just announced  5.3BILLION in profits for 2024   Earth s hottest year on record. While Eni makes these obscene profits their business - the extraction and combustion of fossil fuels - is driving deadly extreme weather and damage to people s homelands and livelihoods. The hundreds of billions they rake in have been taken from the pockets of individuals and families pushing basic necessities out of reach for many - either directly through skyrocketing energy bills that have been exacerbating the cost of living or indirectly with industry tax breaks and subsidies. Individuals families and small businesses should not have to bear rising energy costs or go without basic needs while oil and gas companies laugh all the way to the bank. Their emissions poison our atmosphere while their waste contaminates the water we drink and the air we breathe. Treating our communities and planet as collateral damage these corporations ignore the consequences of extreme weather while homes are destroyed and livelihoods wiped out. The fossil fuel industry has been aware of this crisis they caused for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated $ 301 billion USD* paid by the taxpayer. It s time for justice: governments must make these companies stop drilling for polluting fuels and start paying for the damage they ve caused and the just and fair transition we need. Tag @ eni in the comments and demand they stop drilling and start paying! . . .  Claudio Descalzi CEO of Eni in a retouched image (top). Woman near her house after floods in Migori and Homa Bay Counties in Kenya in 2020 (below). *According to insurers Gallagher Re Images of CEOs used in this campaign are staged and doctored for illustrative purposes. Illustrations are created without the use of generative AI. #stopdrillingstartpaying #climatecrisis

Caption: We re celebrating World Oceans Day with actress model and TV presenter amandadupont who recently met coastal communities in Senegal to support them in their fight for survival. Deeply touched by the encounter Amanda said:  These communities have a special relationship with the ocean because fishing has been in their families for centuries the ocean is in their blood. However the industrial fishing industry is robbing them of their livelihoods and destroying their way of life and they ve had enough! From Thailand to Senegal they re taking a stand against corporations plundering the oceans for profit stealing food from their tables and leaving their families to go hungry. I m standing with them will you? Sign the petition at the link in our bio!#WorldOceansDay

Caption: Started by a small group of passionate Pasifika students the #ClimateICJAO campaign has grown into the biggest climate case in history demanding accountability for a liveable planet.  International Court of Justice Advisory Opinion (ICJAO) is an initiative by the world championed by the youth of the Pacific taking the worlds biggest problem of climate change to the worlds highest court - the International Court of Justice (ICJ).  Now the issue is in court and during the public hearings starting December 2 we will hear states present so that the ICJ can consider all evidence and real impact stories. The court will also hand out an advisory opinion on what states responsibilities are when it comes to addressing climate change in ensuring the protection of the human rights of current and future generations. These voices can t wait. And as their islands sink lands flood and livelihoods continue to be uprooted the #WitnessStand brings their raw stories to light.   The  Witness Stand  is a collection of videos created by our friends at pisfcc co-created with the interactivemediafoundation s not.just.celsius and in partnership with wy4cj. #ClimateJusticeAtTheICJ #ClimateJustice

Caption: Despite what you might see in movies this is what human trafficking usually looks like. No violent kidnapping no chains. But a person looking for work who ends up trapped in a cycle of exploitation. Follow migrant fisher Lukman* as he tries to claim what is rightfully his after toiling for months on end fishing for tuna on an industry vessel in international waters.  You can watch the hard hitting oceans documentary Before You Eat to learn more about the situation for so many migrant fishers in Southeast Asia. Register and watch for free via link in bio. *not his real name : vireeys  #ProtectOceansProtectWorkers#EndModernSlaveryatSEA #StopIUUFishing

Caption: Greenpeace needs your support against Big Oil company Energy Transfer s attempt to silence us A meritless lawsuit filed by energytransferlp against Greenpeace threatens our continued existence as well as the future of peaceful protest and activism around the world.  Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace! For more than 50 years Greenpeace has taken action in defense of people and the planet. To ensure we can continue this work we need your support. The lawsuit against Greenpeace USA and Greenpeace International filed by Energy Transfer   a US-based fossil fuel company who is responsible for  the Dakota Access Pipeline that sparked a Indigenous-led protest movement in 2016   makes allegations that affect people far beyond Greenpeace: Not only an attempt to undermine the Indigenous leadership of the Standing Rock movement this lawsuit aims to silence anyone with the courage to stand up to polluters in their own backyard.  Show your community that you support Greenpeace by sharing this post  Tell energytransferlp they cannot silence the call for a green and peaceful future by signing the petition linked in our bio

Caption: If Big Oil gets its way there ll be no point turning your sound on for our videos or even following Greenpeace accounts. That s because Big Oil wants to silence us.  Around the world Big Oil is trying to silence environmental movements with lawsuits that bankrupt activists into silence. Lawsuits like the one Energy Transfer is currently taking out against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace USA for US$300 million. That s barely enough to make a dent in Energy Transfer s US$80 billion revenue. For us it s an attack that could threaten the future of Greenpeace in the USA.  We don t think Big Oil should be able to silence the climate movement. Do you? Back free speech. Back Greenpeace. Sign the open letter now  PS. If you AGREE that free speech is crucial when we re facing a GLOBAL CLIMATE CRISIS make some noise in the comments like and SHARE. #ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced : Stock Media provided by kheaven / Pond5 UHD_Productions / Pond5 blvdoneprime / Pond5 Stock131 / Pond5 dream_one / Pond5 wesleyfester / Pond5 HeroImages / Pond5 PBS NewsHour EKOenergy ecolabel CNBC International News UN Climate Change United Nations Bioneers

Caption: Greenpeace Nordic activists confront the deep sea mining industry!Named after the Norse god Loke known to be a deceitful trickster Loke Marine Minerals is one of the companies aiming to mine the seabed in the Arctic. We can t let Loke play tricks and gamble with the Arctic s deep sea.Norway has decided to open up the Arctic to deep sea mining but it s home to an incredible diversity of species that we barely know. The deep ocean must be protected at all costs and we cannot allow companies like Loke to destroy it.  More to come in our story!Take action and sign the petition to protect the Arctic before it s too late. #StopDeepSeaMining #SaveTheArctic #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: We asked Yeb Sa o climate activist & Executive Director of greenpeacesea what the relentless pursuit of growth takes away from the majority world.  Time. Give us back our time the time stolen from all of us. Time with family and loved ones and time to be with our communities. Time to achieve our fullest potential. Time to enjoy our freedoms. Time. It sounds like this is a basic human right but I have to say it because we are a long way from achieving it.  In our campaign for a wellbeing economy we re asking activists what their hidden gems are. Hidden gems are: ambitions dreams opportunities and too often the basic rights that GDP and a growth-obsessed economy keep out of reach for our generation. We re calling for a future where people and the planet thrive together.   Sign our petition today and let s demand wellbeing for all! #WellbeingEconomy #Greenpeace

Caption: This morning greenpeaceth activists from Greenpeace flagship Rainbow Warrior conducted a peaceful protest against a proposed carbon capture and storage(CCS) site at the Arthit fossil gas field located in the Gulf of Thailand s exclusive economic zone. The gas field is around 250KM from shore and takes over 20 hours to reach by boat The Arthit fossil gas field is operated by PTTEP It will be the site of Thailands first offshore carbon capture and storage project. It is expected to begin operations in 2027. Greenpeace Thailand calls on PTTEP to hold it accountable for its contribution to the climate crisis by stopping this carbon capture and storage plan immediately.  #ClimateCrisis #Thailand #Greenpeace

Caption: Will you say bana-NAH to deep sea mining?  The Banana Hole is an area in the pristine Arctic that Norway wants to MINE in. Deep sea mining could have devastating irreversible impacts on wildlife like sperm whales and the countless other marine species that call these waters home  The good news is that deep sea mining hasnt started yet. You can use your voice from wherever you are in the world to send an email to Norway s Prime Minister jonasgahr urging him to scrap his plans. It s so easy to make a difference - weve drafted an email template for you so all you have to do is click send! Link in bio.   #StopDeepSeaMining

Caption: BREAKING: In 2024 Exxon Mobil made USD33.5billion in profit... it was also the hottest year on record for the planet! Fossil fuels are the biggest contributor to the climate crisis that causes communities to push through devastating extreme weather everywhere.  The fossil fuel industry has been aware of the crisis they cause for decades but have hidden the truth and discredited the scientific evidence. The economic cost solely from weather and climate events in 2023 was an estimated USD 301 billion (According to insurers Gallagher Re). Now Fossil fuel companies need to pay the price for the damages they ve consciously caused.  People families and communities are paying the price while fossil fuel companies are making record profits out of their suffering. Their profit is our loss. Goverments must protect our families and communities and make oil companies stop drilling and start paying for the damage they ve caused and the just and fair transition we need. Tag your decision-makers in the comments below to phase out fossil fuels to make way for a green safe and more just society. #StopDrillingStartPaying (link in bio) . . .  Darren Woods Exxon Mobil in a retouched image (top). Firefighter at recent California fires (bottom).  Disclaimer: Images of CEOs used in this campaign are staged and doctored for illustrative purposes. Illustrations are created without the use of regenerative AI.

Caption: #TaxTheSuperRich Every year the world s business and political leaders gather in Davos Switzerland. They claim to be there to tackle global issues such as poverty and inequality but the reality is that they re there to protect their own interests. These brave activists are delivering a clear message from people around the world to governments: #TaxTheSuperRich fund a green and just world!  There s enough money for people and the planet to thrive but it remains in the pockets of the super-rich polluting elite who are exploiting the planet beyond its limits.  Share to show your support and join us by signing our petition - link in bio!

Caption: BREAKING: MAJOR VICTORY FOR PEOPLE VS POLLUTERS!  The Norwegian Supreme Court has ruled in favour of greenpeacenorge and naturogungdom against the Norwegian State!  Three illegal oil and gas fields in the North Sea must be shut down immediately. The government approved them without assessing their global climate impact   breaking both Norwegian and European law.  This is a win for people planet and the rule of law.  Next: the Court of Appeals must re-rule. But for now production must stop!  This is just the beginning!    #ClimateJustice

Caption: The flag of the Republic of the Marshall Islands flies at half-mast aboard the Rainbow Warrior in remembrance of the devastating Castle Bravo nuclear test.  . 71 years ago the U.S. detonated a nuclear bomb 1000x more powerful than Hiroshima. The explosion lit up the sky like a second sunrise what Marshallese people call the Day of Two Suns. Radioactive fallout poisoned the communities all over the Marshall Islands forcing them to live in contamination for years leading to severe health issues environmental destruction and the displacement of entire populations.  . Greenpeace and the Rainbow Warrior then and now has stood with the Marshall Islands. In 1985 Greenpeace helped the people of Rongelap evacuate after finding their land uninhabitable. Today while new threats like deep-sea mining and climate change emerge we return to stand with them once more in their ongoing fight for justice. . Check the link in bio to learn more about this history. . . . #MarshallIslands #NuclearJustice  #History #JusticeforMarshallIslands #ClimateJustice #JimweImMaron

Caption: Richly forested Papua in Indonesia is on the frontline of both biodiversity and climate crises due to a relentless push by agribusiness companies backed by international finance that want to clear its forests to make way for palm oil paper pulp and other plantations. Since early 2000 when the Indonesian government started releasing permits for logging and palm oil companies Indigenous Peoples across the island have been engaged in a struggle with outsiders and the government who underestimate the strength of Indigenous connection to their land. For Biodiversity Day the Indigenous People of Knasaimos-Tehit in Papua showed and shared a little insight into what land and forest means for them. #NatureNow #DefundNatureDestruction #SavePapuanForests greenpeaceid

Caption: GREAT NEWS  Thanks to you   more than 1 MILLION people have signed our petition to protect the oceans   Without the oceans there would be no life on Earth. The oceans:  Regulate our climate  Provide food and jobs to billions of people  Are home to iconic creatures like whales and turtles  Scientists have said that we need to protect at least 30% of the oceans by 2030. If governments are serious about doing this they MUST back their words with actions and ratify the historic Global Ocean Treaty  .  Governments can only use the Treaty to create global ocean sanctuaries once at least 60 countries have ratified it. Every moment they delay ratification the oceans suffer further destruction.  If you haven t signed the petition yet check the link in our bio   to urge your government to #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: URGENT UPDATE from Plastics Treaty talks in South Korea  4 Greenpeace International activists were detained last night after peacefully protesting on a petrochemical vessel during final #PlasticsTreaty talks in South Korea.    These courageous activists endured freezing overnight temperatures for 12 hours to be the voice of millions of people around the world   calling on world leaders to cut plastic production.  These activists are sending a strong message to world leaders in the final hours of negotiations: if we can challenge the plastic industry so can world governments.    We urge world leaders to step up to deliver an ambitious treaty that cuts plastic production and call on the South Korean authorities to release our activists immediately!   Sign and share today! Strong Plastics Treaty Now!  . . . #Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5

Caption: We need your help!Our activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the  Zero Plastic Tour  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.ICYMI: On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea. We re grateful for each and every one of your support.Add your voice via link in bio  #Greenpeace

Caption: GOOD NEWS  Seychelles has just become the fourth country to ratify the Global Ocean Treaty! The historic Treaty is a powerful tool for governments to create global ocean sanctuaries  but it can only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have written it into their national laws. This must happen before the UN Ocean Conference in June 2025. We still have a long way to go so urge your government to urgently ratify the Treaty in order to protect at least 30% of the ocean by 2030. Sign the petition check the link in our bio.  #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: Did you know close to $7 TRILLION is invested globally each year in activities that harm our natural world?  Thats about 7% of global GDP! This is contributing to the imminent extinction of around 1 MILLION ANIMAL AND PLANT SPECIES within mere decades more than ever before in human history. The planetary boundaries framework developed by the Stockholm Resilience Centre identifies nine critical processes for Earths stability. Their 2023 research reveals that weve broken 6 out of 9 of these boundaries. The Earth is now well outside of the safe operating space for humanity. Governments must hold banks and corporations accountable and reform our financial sector   Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join us in calling for an end to funding nature destruction. #DefundNatureDestruction #Nature #Sustainability

Caption: Indonesia s peatlands are on fire - both literally and figuratively. GreenpeaceIDs Forest Fires Prevention Team was formed after the catastrophic 2015 fires and haze blanketed Southeast Asia. Today they fight back on every front restoring hope and helping protect these vital lands that store up to 57 gigatons of carbon and shelter iconic wildlife like orangutans and tigers. Meet Rizky Prasitha a member of this remarkable team as he shares why he risks it all to save Indonesia s peatlands. His mission is one of hope courage and commitment to protecting our planet. Watch his story via the link in bio   Send your #HopeforNature to leaders at #COP16! Join us to advocate to #DefundNatureDestruction and demand real action to meet the Global Biodiversity Framework goals so we can stop this #WorldOnFire!

At this upcoming summit world leaders have the opportunity but also the responsibility to transform promises into concrete actions to protect 30% of land and marine ecosystems by 2030  Theres NO time to waste. Time to act is NOW!  Ja r F. Coll /Greenpeace #COP16Colombia #GPCOP16 #GreenpeaceCOP16

Caption: The WORST place in the world to drill for oil  Conkouati-Douli National Park a UNESCO-recognised coastal national park the most biodiverse protected area in the Republic of Congo is under threat from a new oil exploration permit. 7000 people depend on the park for their livelihoods. This vital ecosystem is home to endangered species like chimpanzees Western lowland gorillas forest elephants and leatherback turtles. Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join us in demanding the immediate cancellation of this ecocidal oil permit! via greenpeaceafrica #SaveCongoRainforest #Congo #oil #ConkouatiDouli #StopDrillingStartPaying #ClimateCrisis #BiodiversityCrisis

Caption: A world without emperor penguins   is just too sad to imagine   but a brand-new report highlights this shocking possibility.  . When penguin chicks hatch they re not able to swim as they don t have their waterproof feathers yet but climate change is causing the sea ice to melt earlier in the year which causes the tiny chicks to drown if the ice gives way beneath them  . The ocean provides a buffer against impacts from the climate crisis but that comes at a huge cost to the ocean itself causing its health to drastically decline. . So will we safeguard the oceans by drastically reducing our emissions and urging governments to create ocean sanctuaries to protect at least 30% of the oceans by 2030? The Global Ocean Treaty enables governments to do this but it will only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have ratified it.  . Tell your government to ratify the Treaty NOW! . Sign the petition   LINK IN BIO And check out the report In Hotter Water: How the Global Ocean Treaty can boost climate action on our website. . . . #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: Norway s deep sea mining plans in the Arctic are not a-peeling In the Arctic a banana-shaped region - that is about the size of the UK - is under threat from deep sea mining. This could cause irreversible damage to the fragile untouched ecosystem. The deep sea in the Arctic is largely unexplored so species could be lost here before they have even been discovered! The Norwegian Prime Minister jonasgahrs needs to scrap his dangerous plans and make the right choice to protect the oceans for current and future generations. Sign the petition if you agree  #StopDeepSeaMining

Caption: Greenpeace hopes that the start of today s fragile Lebanon ceasefire agreement can mark a turning point in the brutal conflict that has taken so many innocent lives. Today must become the anchor point for de-escalation and an unconditional comprehensive and permanent ceasefire throughout the Middle East!  After 416 days of violence the humanitarian and environmental devastation is unbearable. The bullets and bombs must also fall silent in Gaza. It is time for a massive and unhindered humanitarian relief effort and peaceful negotiations towards a lasting peace built on safety justice and equal rights for all. International law must be upheld. We call on Hamas to immediately release all hostages. We call for the Israeli Government to immediately end the blockades on the supply of food water medicine and fuel to the people of Gaza and release all illegally detained civilians. Greenpeace calls for a global embargo on all arms sales and transfers that could be used to further increase the toll of war crimes to be answered by both sides once this war and conflict ends. Greenpeace recognises the deep historic roots that need to be discussed and negotiated if a permanent peace is to be established. Greenpeace calls for an end to the illegal occupation of Palestine. Greenpeace supports the UNSC Resolution ambition that  Israel and Palestine live side by side in peace within secure and recognised borders consistent with international law and relevant UN resolutions. #CeasefireNow

Caption: A WN IN THE AMAZON It s time to celebrate a historic and profound victory! The Munduruku People have been fighting for the rights to Sawr  Muybu an Indigenous Land located in the Tapaj s River Basin in the heart of the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. After almost 20 years of struggle the Sawr  Muybu territory was officially demarcated. The demarcation of Sawr  Muybu is a victory that transcends borders. It reinforces the idea that we can protect the Amazon with persistence and solidarity. More than ever we have reason to celebrate and continue the fight. Saw !

Caption: VICTORY! Today s groundbreaking Advisory Opinion by the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea confirms it: Greenhouse gases harm our oceans. States must reduce GHGs to protect our seas safeguard communities and preserve biodiversity. The ruling highlights the urgent need for action on climate change to protect our oceans. To do so governments must phase out fossil fuels and protect marine biodiversity. The health of our oceans is vital for the well-being of all forms of life. . . . #ITLOSAO #ClimateJustice #ProtectOurOceans

Caption: Have you ever plunged into the Antarctic Ocean depths in a small submarine to marvel at the breathtaking marine life we don t often get to see? Most people haven t been that lucky   But if you watch Polar Abyss you ll be able to explore the mysterious worlds that remain hidden beneath the Antarctic and Arctic Oceans  This is one of the short film companions to the major new documentary series Our Oceans now on Netflix. All the episodes aim to highlight the various connections we share with the oceans whether it s through the air we breathe or the food we eat because all life on Earth depends on the oceans #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: BREAKING  After a historic win earlier this year GreenpeaceNorge and NaturogUngdom are facing the Norwegian government in Court again in an effort to immediately halt the ongoing development of three illegal oil fields. In January an Oslo District Court ruling invalidated the previous approvals of these projects for lack of impact assessments of global climate effects. They also issued orders restraining any new permits for the fields  Since then the Norwegian state has appealed the decisions and ignored the injunctions. Taking ambitious action to address the climate emergency is a duty of states and not some favour to communities. This case is part of a movement where people across the world are holding to account those responsible for the climate and nature crises which affect fundamental human rights.  #ClimateJustice

Caption: Capturing Costa Ricas Conservation Triumph    Did you hear of  Costa Ricas remarkable journey towards environmental sustainability? By eliminating environmentally harmful subsidies that encouraged activities such as cattle ranching Costa Rica achieved an astounding 80% reduction in deforestation rates!    Could this be a role model for other regions?  Intact forest landscapes and other nature areas are our safety net and key for humanity to thrive. Get all the info in the link in bio   and sign our manifesto to #DefundNatureDestruction

Caption: GREENWASHING ALERT    Oil and chemical companies who created  The Alliance to END Plastic Waste  have produced 1000x MORE NEW PLASTIC in five years than the waste they cleaned up according to a Greenpeace Unearthed investigation. Faulty recycling schemes like these barely make a dent in the mountain of waste these companies produce. It s hard to imagine a clearer example of greenwashing  The solution is simple: We must REDUCE plastic production at its source. The world needs a strong #PlasticsTreaty that CAPS production. No more excuses.  Go to the link in our Instagram bio to sign the petition to demand real action NOW. #unearthed #greenpeace #investigation #singleuseplastic #plasticcrisis #recycling #greenwashing

Caption: You can t gamble with the Arctic seabed!  greenpeacenorge protested against Loke Marine Minerals a Norwegian company that wants to start deep sea mining in the depths of the Arctic. This company is committed to mining the oceans regardless of warnings from scientists fisheries and civil society.  Actors and Greenpeace ambassadors gustafskarsgard and his brother valterskarsgard joined us to protect the Arctic from the deep sea mining industry and the damages it would cause to this fragile ecosystem. You can help us by amplifying our message: share this post!  #StopDeepSeaMining #SaveTheArctic #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: Greenpeace needs your support against Big Oil company Energy Transfer s attempt to silence us A meritless lawsuit filed by energytransferlp against Greenpeace threatens our continued existence as well as the future of peaceful protest and activism around the world.  Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace! For more than 50 years Greenpeace has taken action in defense of people and the planet. To ensure we can continue this work we need your support. The lawsuit against Greenpeace USA and Greenpeace International filed by Energy Transfer   a US-based fossil fuel company who is responsible for  the Dakota Access Pipeline that sparked a Indigenous-led protest movement in 2016   makes allegations that affect people far beyond Greenpeace: Not only an attempt to undermine the Indigenous leadership of the Standing Rock movement this lawsuit aims to silence anyone with the courage to stand up to polluters in their own backyard.  Show your community that you support Greenpeace by sharing this post  Tell energytransferlp they cannot silence the call for a green and peaceful future by signing the petition linked in our bio

Caption: A dozen South Sumatran residents attended Palembang District Court this morning to register a lawsuit against three plantation companies over the chronic smoke haze that has blighted their lives due to fires repeatedly burning on peatland inside the companies  concession areas. The three companies named in the lawsuit are PT Bumi Mekar Hijau (BMH) PT Bumi Andalas Permai (BAP) and PT Sebangun Bumi Andalas Wood Industries (SBA Wood Industries). The drainage and destruction of peatlands in these areas which subsequently leads to out-of-control forest fires and haze severely exacerbates the climate crisis. The increase in carbon emissions due to forest fires and haze also undermines emissions reduction efforts jeopardizing the achievement of Indonesia s climate targets  said greenpeaceID Forest Campaigner Belgis Habiba. Supported by a coalition of civil society and environmental organisations called the South Sumatra Smoke Suit Initiative (Inisiasi Sumatera Selatan Penggugat Asap   ISSPA) the twelve residents are asking the court to award compensation for the deprivation of their right to a healthy environment and for environmental restoration after the fires which have harmed them both materially and immaterially. #RightToCleanAir #ActOnClimate #AirPollution #ClimateCrisis

Caption: The Unfair Truth: While big agribusiness receives the majority of support farmers like Mr. Nene get almost no support and fires are often initiated by middle and large farms creating damage to land climate and communities nearby.  According to Plano Safra in 2024 84% of rural credit went to agribusiness leaving just 15% for family farmers who grow most of the food we actually eat.  How is that fair? As the Amazon burns and biodiversity suffers Mr. Nene shows us there s a better way. His shift to ecological farming proves we can farm sustainably and heal the planet Send your message of #HopeForNature to political leaders at the UN Biodiversity #COP16 and demand action to protect the Amazon and support those who are protecting our future   Link   in bio! #worldonfire  . . . . #RestoreNature #PeaceWithNature #GreenpeaceCOP16 #GPCOP16

Caption: Finally!  After years of campaigning for transparent fisheries management by greenpeaceafrica fishing communities in Senegal celebrated a huge win. The Senegalese government made the decision to publish the list of vessels authorised to fish in the countrys national waters. It is a step towards transparency sustainability and ocean justice. Fishing communities in Senegal have worked tirelessly for this milestone. It deserves to be celebrated.  Head to the link in bio to find out how you support Senegals call for ocean justice    . . . #ocean #oceanlife #oceanlover #oceanbeach #fisheries #fishing #senegal #justice

Caption: Dive into the heart of the ocean with us   From the Pacific to the Arctic our oceans sustain diverse cultures livelihoods and forms of life   Yet despite being the least responsible island and coastal communities are those most impacted by climate impacts such as rising sea levels and ocean acidification. Together we demand that States act on climate change and protect our common blue heritage for present and future generations.  Join us as we await the historic advisory opinion of the International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS) on climate change on Tuesday May 21st an opportunity of change for climate justice and ocean protection.  . . .  #ITLOSAO #ProtectOurOceans #oceans #ocean #oceanlife #climatechange #climatecrisis #justice

Caption: NEWS WORTH CELEBRATING The EU Parliament just voted to ratify the Global Ocean Treaty      With a significant majority of 556 to 36 the EU vote could inspire others to ratify.  At present only four countries have ratified the Treaty   Palau Chile Belize and Seychelles. Its now up to the 27 EU member states to follow in their footsteps and urgently ratify the Treaty before the next UN Ocean Conference in June 2025. This will enable governments to cover the ocean in a network of sanctuaries and to protect at least 30% of the global ocean by 2030.  . . . #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: The EU does NOT need to expand gas supply to secure Europe s energy  https://bit.ly/3QpNqKD Expanding fossil gas is driving us even deeper into the #climatecrisis and is in clear contradiction with the need to limit global heating to 1.5 C  It s outrageous to see Azerbaijan set to host the next UN climate summit defending plans for increasing fossil gas production which undermines the crucial call for collective action to fight the climate crisis and secure a safe future.Instead of drilling for and burning even more fossil gas we need to speed up the transition to renewable energy and improve energy efficiency  The time to #StopFossilGas is now.#StopDrillingStartPaying

Caption: Greenpeace activists in more than 15 cities around the world are expressing solidarity against the abusive legal tactics of US-based fossil fuel company Energy TransferLP (ET) during two sustained global weeks of action. Greenpeace International (GPI) and the Greenpeace entities in the US are currently defending against a meritless US$ 300 million lawsuit from ET related to the Indigenous-led protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline in 2016. From Paris to Indonesia this global week of action sends a clear message:  We will not be silenced! Globally more and more corporations are using dirty legal tricks like SLAPP suits to intimidate and silence their critics. Hundreds of SLAPPs spanning every continent are currently in progress. This case brought by Energy Transfer is one of the most egregious and if it goes unanswered it will embolden other companies to do the same.  Check the link in our bio to sign a petition that tells Energy Transfer and all corporate bullies: I am with Greenpeace!

Caption: Trigger Warning: Graphic Animal Content    Every rescue is 50/50 so I have a 50% chance of failure   Paula s reality is unfortunately one of many. Her daily fight to save wild animals in Brazil s burning Pantanal is shaped by a combination between climate change and criminal fires often initiated by the agriculture sector.The agricultural sector along with banks and investors remains largely unaccountable for the severe environmental and social impacts of their actions. Despite the immense harm caused including loss of biodiversity and increased greenhouse gas emissions there is insufficient scrutiny on how hundreds of millions of dollars in loans and investments contribute to the destruction of natural ecosystems.According to a recent MapBiomas  guas survey the Pantanal s water surface has shrunk by 61% since 1985. In 2020 fires tragically claimed the lives of 17 million animals including 1.5 million birds and 458000 primates as reported in the 2021 study  Wildfire in the Pantanal: Impacts and Management Challenges .As we approach the UN Biodiversity COP16 in Cali Colombia let s raise our voices. Join us in sending a message of #HopeForNature to political leaders and demand them to act for nature including properly regulating financial flows that enable an endless destruction!  Click the link in our bio to learn more and take action. Share Paula s story because together we can protect these vital ecosystems  #WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestruction  outcastfilm_ StudioBirthplace rob_natali

Caption: Just because natural gas has the word  natural  in it doesn t mean that it is safe for the planet the people and the climate.  1. Gas is already responsible for 22% of global greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel combustion. 2. Fossil fuel extraction is responsible for tremendous social impacts and human rights violations in Global Majority countries. 3. Gas exploration and gas infrastructure such as platforms and pipelines are particularly damaging to nature: deforestation release of harmful pollutants noise from seismic surveys that endanger whales and dolphins 4. Recent studies suggest that gas stoves put people at greater risk of respiratory disease than previously thought. Recent estimates put the number of deaths from fossil fuel air pollution at 5 million per year.  5. Explosions fires and earthquakes are common events in the gas business at every step of the supply chain. Read more about it here   act.gp/whygasisbad  #StopFossilGas #SaveThePlanet #Earth #Green #GoGreen #ClimateChange

Caption: What is carbon footprint and where does it come from? The greenpeaceships crew has a clue!  The concept of carbon footprint was born as one indicator of our impact on the Earth. However the idea really took off in 2003 when the oil and gas company BP launched a campaign. It was a clever trick on their part as they pushed corporate guilt onto us personally while they carried on drilling for fossil fuels!  So what if carbon footprint came to life for a little revenge in the form of an animation? If youre curious check out our link in bio  #Animation #MyPetFootprint #Comedy #Cartoon #Greenpeace

Caption: ICYMI: On 30 November 2024 4 Greenpeace activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty.  Fast forward 2.5 months later Al - one of the 4 activists - decided to pen their own story in their own voice from their own perspective. The 4 activists unable to leave the country continue to reside in Korea as they undergo their investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the  Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia. For Al s story check our link in bio.  #INC5Warriors #Greenpeace

Caption: Do you know what #COP29 is? As COP29 is approaching world leaders will gather from Monday 11 November to Friday 22 November in Baku Azerbaijan   yet another country with fossil fuel interests   at the 29th annual climate negotiations. Since the world experiences month after month of record temperatures and we move closer and closer to the global heating limit set out in the Paris Agreement we need real firm action at COP29 to limit global heating to 1.5 C. Find out what you need to know about the annual global climate summit

Caption: The concept of Mind Bombs centers on using powerful stories to change the world rather than actual bombs. It was first coined by Bob Hunter during the 1970s Anti-Whaling Campaign where Greenpeace activists set out to photograph the damages caused by commercial whaling in the North Pacific. These photos by Rex Weyler showed the world the devastating deaths of numerous whales done for the sake of profit. This non-violent action greatly influenced the International Whaling Committee to put a moratorium on commercial whaling in 1982 and a total ban in 1985.Source: BBC#whales #ClimateAction #oceans #photography
Cleaned Caption: the concept of mind bombs centers on using powerful stories to change the world rather than actual bombs it was first coined by bob hunter during the 1970s antiwhaling campaign where greenpeace activists set out to photograph the damages caused by commercial whaling in the north pacific these photos by rex weyler showed the world the devastating deaths of numerous whales done for the sake of profit this nonviolent action greatly influenced the international whaling committee to put a moratorium on commercial whaling in 1982 and a total ban in 1985source bbc#whales #climateaction #oceans #photography

Caption: BREAKING: 18 Greenpeace activists from Germany and the Netherlands are currently at sea protesting the installation of a gas extraction platform belonging to the Dutch energy company ONE-Dyas.The greenpeace.de and greenpeacenl activists have anchored three floating islands at the destination of the production platform which is expected to arrive. Other activists are demonstrating in rubber dinghies and kayaks for the protection of the Wadden Sea their flags and banners bearing the slogans  Gas destroys!  and  No New Gas .#StopDrillingStartPaying#FossilFreeFuture

Caption: Have you ever wondered what the experience is like for the fishers who catch the fish that ends up on supermarket shelves around the world?  Illegal unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing is one of the most serious threats to our oceans  health and covers any activity that contravenes the law including human slavery. .On the upcoming International Day for the Fight against IUU Fishing we highlight why we need to protect the ocean and #EndModernSlaveryatSEA...#StopIUUFishing

Caption: Obsession with growth and productivity has made us forget what s truly important in life.GDP (Gross Domestic Product) which has long been the main metric of economic success fails to respect planetary boundaries and human needs causing the polycrisis we re facing today. Through art installations in collaboration with the Jakarta Art Institute greenpeaceid redefines the meaning of what makes our lives worth living and our planet more hospitable and find the true hidden gems in life. These installations are also aimed as a call to go beyond GDP during the UN Summit of the Future. Greenpeace believes that wellbeing can t be measured with just numbers. Life is much more complex as we need other things like the environment quality and affordable education families and also a good and fair government for the wellbeing of the people and planet  said Rahka Susanto greenpeaceid Project Lead.

Caption: You know how annoying it is when you can t get a signal right?  But spare a thought for those working far out at sea - there s simply no signal on our oceans.In August the Rainbow Warrior sailed from Taiwan to Hawai i and shared its WiFi with migrant fishers on distant water fishing vessels along the way.Improving WiFi coverage in international waters would improve both the wellbeing and the safety and protection for people in some of the world s most dangerous jobs. It would also serve to increase transparency regarding illegal fishing practices.Help us increase the coverage this #WorldFisheriesDay!

Caption: In the heart of Bangsal village South Sumatra Indonesia a rich tapestry of culture and tradition is under threat from smoke haze linked to devastating peatland fires ignited by corporate plantations. Did you know? Indonesia s tropical peatlands are a biodiversity hotspot home to magnificent creatures like orangutans and tigers! Yet these vibrant ecosystems are being drained for palm oil and pulpwood turning lush landscapes into fire-prone zones.    Together we rise for justice! Let s unite in solidarity with the courageous residents of Bangsal as they fight to safeguard their rich culture and environment from the grasp of corporate greed and share your message of #HopeForNature with world leaders at the UN Biodiversity COP16. Watch the full video via link in bio!  #WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestructionNow

Caption: ** Don t let Big Oil silence the climate movement. Back Greenpeace now. ** Around the world Big Oil is attempting to sue Greenpeace to suppress free speech and limit people power. Like Energy Transfer the company behind the Dakota Access Pipeline which is suing Greenpeace USA and Greenpeace International for US$300 million. If they win Greenpeace in the USA might have to shut its doors.  Energy Transfer s meritless lawsuit is an attack on free speech and peaceful protest. It s part of a concerted global attack by Big Oil which includes lawsuits from Big Oil corporations like ENI Shell and TotalEnergies.  But Big Oil doesn t realise the strength of the climate movement. They might be an oil tanker. But together we can be this giant unstoppable scaly sea monster. Back those who speak truth to power. Back free speech. Back Greenpeace.  Share with a friend who doesnt like bullies #ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Act now and tell world leaders to step up and support a strong Global #PlasticsTreaty that cuts plastic production! Caption: The Metals Company (TMC) is at it again trying to sidestep the International Seabed Authority (ISA) to push deep sea mining through US law instead. This move also makes it pretty clear that the company s plans were never focused on climate solutions but on exploiting the ocean and Pacific communities for profit. With 32 countries already backing a moratorium its time for world leaders to step up and stop this reckless industry before it starts!  The ocean needs us are you in?  The time to act is now. Sign the petition: link   in bio  #StopDeepSeaMining #ProtectTheOceans

Caption: Its been over 100 days and we need your help!Our activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the  Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia.ICYMI: On 30 November the activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea. We re grateful for each and every one of your support.Add your voice via link in bio. : greenpeaceuk #Greenpeace

Caption: 40 years ago the Rainbow Warrior took part in a historic event on the Marshall Islands - a massive relocation effort to help evacuate the people of Rongelap to Mejatto due to decades of US government nuclear weapons testing. . They say we rescued them from a contaminated #Rongelap but the reality is that they rescued themselves - the Marshallese are the strong and brave people who took their future into their own hands and continue to do so.  . We cannot relocate the world   it is only through standing and acting together that we will make the needed difference that saves us all. In the fight for justice our voices will not be silenced. Jimwe im Maron - Justice! . . . #MarshallIslands #NuclearJustice  #History #JusticeforMarshallIslands #ClimateJustice #JimweImMaron

Caption: Yes the emissions from meat and dairy giants rival those of fossil fuel companies. A Greenpeace Nordic report released a few months ago revealed that JBS the worlds largest meat producer would rank 5th if put on a list alongside the reportedly biggest methane emitting corporations and rivals the methane emissions reported for major oil companies ExxonMobil and Shell combined. We urgently need to put an end to the overproduction and overconsumption of industrial meat and dairy. We must reject ever-larger factory farms cruel polluting and destructive and push for a massive shift towards more plant-based diets wherever possible. We must also expose and reject the misleading marketing tactics of the industry which does everything it can to slow the decline in meat and dairy consumption and delay this vital transition. A few months ago Greenpeace activists from several countries took action outside the headquarters of major companies in the sector. They were there to remind us that we can and must meaningfully slow climate breakdown within our lifetime by transitioning to a just food system one that moves away from industrial meat and dairy production and promotes plant-based alternatives and call on governments to act urgently to support this transition.    IATP / Bryce Groves / Jana Eriksson / Michael Hedelain / Greenpeace #climatecrisis #meatanddairy #lessmeatlessheat #stopfactoryfarming #plantbased

Caption: All we need is hope AND ACTION   from world leaders to bring commitments to protect and restore nature to life.  Right before UN Biodiversity #COP16 started in Cali Colombia activists around the globe projected a stunning visual story transforming urgency into hope   They highlighted the impact of destructive industries and celebrated messages of restoration sent in by people from every corner of the world  Imagine seeing that transformation in  real life.  The urgency is real - heat waves floods and fires are scorching our planet and the collapse of biodiversity threatens our very existence. And wouldn t it be incredible if the US$7 trillion (UNEP) that banks and corporations currently fueling said activities harming our planet were redirected to reparations and positive change instead?  #HopeForNature #DefundNatureDestruction #RestoreNature #COP16 #PeaceWithNature

Caption: ACTION ALERT Over the last 24 hours Greenpeace activists from a number of countries have paid a visit to some of the worlds meat and dairy giants.  Industrial meat and dairy products are leaving a trail of destruction around the world. If we put a brake on Big Meat and Dairy corporations curbing the unrestrained growth of their factory farms and the emissions they produce particularly methane which is driving climate chaos and make a massive switch to more plant-based diets wherever possible we can slow down global heating within this decade! Tap the link in our Instagram bio to join the movement  :   Bryce Groves / Jana Eriksson / Michael Hedelain / Greenpeace #meat #dairy #stopfactoryfarming #climatecrisis #methane  #makemethanevisible #greenpeace

Caption: NO OLYMPICS ON A DEAD PLANET!This year s Olympics in Paris had been hailed as the  Green Games  yet their major sponsor Toyota has higher CO2 emissions than the entire country of France and according to the New Weather Institute has the highest annual emissions among all the sponsors.We are calling on Toyota to cut carbon emissions by:1. Aligning their business plans with the Paris Climate Agreement.2. Commiting to globally stop selling new fossil fuel vehicles including hybrids by 2030 at the latest.3. Stopping their attempts to water down climate policies and targets across the world.Sign Greenpeace East Asia s open letter in bio #ParisOlympics #Paris2024 #Olympics #Toyota #DriveChange #ZeroEmission #ActCnClimate

Caption: Im Ash.  Last November during #INC5 hosted in Busan city we boarded a gas tanker as part of a peaceful protest to send a strong message about global plastic pollution and as a result I along with my fellow activists Al Sam Jens and Captain Hettie have been prohibited from leaving South Korea under the orders of the Minister of Justice. During this time of being unable to leave the country I received the heartbreaking news of my grandmother s passing. Because of this travel restriction I was unable to attend her funeral. This has left me feeling deeply saddened as I am stuck in Korea waiting for the legal proceedings to conclude with no end in sight unable to grieve alongside my family. 2 months later we are still in Korea waiting for the legal process to unfold. So far no specific timeline has been provided by the Korean judiciary it has been just an endless uncertain wait for the 5 of us. As the Lunar New Year approaches a time in Asia that traditionally symbolizes family reunions the 5 of us remain in Korea carrying the weight of longing for our loved ones and the hopes of our families awaiting our return.  Please sign the petition to help us end this legal process faster so that we may return home to our families soon.   - Ash Greenpeace activist  Photo by Taekyoung Jung #INC5Warriors #Greenpeace

Caption: From the main bridge leading to Nusantara the new captital city of Indonesia in East Kalimantan GreenpeaceID activists unfurled a long banner in the colours of the national flag reading  Indonesia is not for sale: Merdeka! (Freedom!)  when commemorating the countrys Independence Day this past weekend. The development of Nusantara impacts on Indigenous land rights forests and wildlife. Environment is degraded Indigenous people and local communities are evicted from their land even criminalised when struggling to find their home.The future Indonesian government must immediately act to stop deforestation and preserve the biodiversity to implement solutions to ensure that the country remains livable for the people.#IndonesiaIsNotForSaleMerdeka #Indonesia #ClimateJustice #SocialJustice #ClimateCrisis

Caption: Climate crisis is a BURNING issue - literally.Right now G20 leaders are meeting in South Africa to find solutions to global economic and financial issues. But they must face reality: the climate crisis and skyrocketing inequality are twin emergencies demanding urgent action.Taxing the ultra-rich is not just an option it s a necessity. The revenue must be used to fight poverty protect the most vulnerable and communities hit hardest by climate disasters and fund a just transition.Global tax rules are still controlled by a small clique of wealthy countries allowing billionaires and corporations to shift profits and dodge taxes. For too long this system has let the super-rich hoard wealth while those most affected by the climate and social crises pay the price. It s a moral outrage.Greenpeace and many others are fighting to make taxing the super-rich a global reality. Join the movement! Tap the link in our bio.#TaxTheSuperRich #FightInequality #LivesBeforeProfits #ClimateCrisis #ClimateBreakdown #ExtremeWeather #ClimateDisasters

Caption: Greenpeace Pictures of the Week  This week we ve witnessed inspiring moments from around the globe. Students in Indonesia learned about tackling forest fires while Bulgaria focused on Black Sea conservation efforts. In the Philippines typhoon survivors rallied for change and at the UK Parliament a bid to protect the Sargasso Sea was launched. Meanwhile activists in Germany displayed a giant CO2 symbol highlighting the risks of carbon capture plans. Not to mention a march for clean water in the UK and solidarity action in Greece challenging oil and gas corporations attempts to silence civil society around the world. Swipe left to discover our best photographs from the past seven days.  Join us in spreading the message of environmental advocacy!  . . . #Greenpeace #PicsOfTheWeek #ClimateAction #ProtectTheOceans #BreakFreeFromPlastic #Nature #PeoplePower #BiodiversityOverBanks #IndigenousRights #RainbowWarrior

Caption: Communities are leading climate action    Members of the El Bosque community from Tabasco Mexico are speaking today before the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (IACtHR) in Manaus Brazil to demand climate justice!      For over five years the El Bosque community has experienced the severe impacts of the climate crisis. Over 60 families have been displaced by sea level rise and coastal erosion. The Advisory Opinion from the IACtHR could clarify the obligations of States and corporations under international and human rights law.  Impacted communities civil society organisations scientists and academics are sharing their demands at the IACtHR. This journey started through the advice requested by Colombia and Chile on States  human rights obligations in the context of the #ClimateEmergency. Go to the link in our bio to learn more about this pivotal process and why the leadership and activism of the communities is essential! : Gustavo Graf/Greenpeace. #ClimateJustice #IACtHR #CorteIDH

Caption: Governments are meeting at the United Nations HQ in New York City this week on the UN Ocean Treaty for the first time since the treaty opened for signatures in September 2023.  . So far seven countries have ratified the Global Ocean Treaty (Palau Chile Belize Seychelles Monaco Mauritius Federated States of Micronesia) but leaders serious about ocean protection have a lot of work to do this week to bring the Treaty to life at sea.

Caption: All this destruction for GOLD. Illegal gold mining in the Amazon isn t just destroying forests. It s poisoning rivers wildlife and Indigenous communities. Mercury used to extract gold is now in the food chain found in fish animals and people. In some Yanomami villages an Indigenous people living deep in the Amazon 84% of residents are contaminated. This is toxic deadly and entirely preventable. At #COP30 in November leaders must act to end the toxic gold trade and protect the Amazon for good. If not now WHEN?  Go to act.gp/RespectTheAmazon to add your voice #RespectTheAmazon #ToxicGold #Amazon #BiodiversityCrisis #ClimateCrisis #IndigenousRights #IndigenousPeoples

Caption: The Fight for Alternatives Global Assembly hosted by fightinequality has kicked off in Manila Philippines today. Human rights defenders climate activists  trade unionists artists academics and like-minded individuals from around the world are gathering to discuss solutions to inequality and how to build an economic system that prioritizes people and the planet. We re here at the event and will share highlights in the coming days!As the assembly begins we re reminded of the harsh realities the majority world faces today. With the worsening climate crisis already vulnerable countries like the Philippines are becoming even more susceptible to disasters. Earlier this week Typhoon Yagi caused flooding and landslides in several provinces displacing thousands and devastating livelihoods. This cycle of destruction must end. We need an economic system that prioritizes the well-being of all over financial gain.1. Participants getting to know each other as part of the opening ceremony.2. Greenpeace collaborated with Filipino mural artist AG Sa o on an immersive  street art  experience uncovering the Hidden Gems Generation. More on this later this week until then: flip the image for some treasures! )3. United in the fight against inequality. 4. Lidy Nacpil Filipino human rights environmental gender and social justice activist shared powerful words during the opening ceremony.5. Starting the day with these incredible Ati-Atihan drummers. Way to kick off the Assembly! Photos by Jilson Tiu/Greenpeace#WellbeingEconomy #SystemsChange #climatechange #economy

Caption: Loneliness has emerged as a significant global public health concern*. It even gets worse in the cities.Our crowded but isolating cities have become a clear manifestation of a system that prioritises profit consumption and individualism. Add polarisation constant bad news increasing conflict and climate anxiety it s easy to feel hopeless.However cities have also been the birthplace of powerful social movements throughout history. They all start with people coming together breaking down isolation and creating a sense of purpose while driving real change in the making.  In the new episode of #SystemShift podcast we speak to souamandacosta a climate activist who is passionate about communities and collective power especially with favelas in Brazil     Listen/watch the full episode  Are Urban Communities a Remedy for Loneliness?  via the link in our bio  *Source: WHO 2023

Caption: Governments have failed to finalize a Global #PlasticsTreaty during UN talks in Busan South Korea on Sunday Night. This is not the message we wanted to bring you but hope is not lost! 100 countries stood up to the fossil fuel industry to reject a weak treaty.This means talks will extend into 2025 and world leaders need to know that the only definition of a strong treaty is one that cuts plastic production not treaty ambition! Let s do everything in our power to make sure an ambitious treaty happens next year for people and planet! We can t waste any more time to stop the plastic crisis. Caption: Have you spotted a ghost octopus near you?!  From the helideck of the Arctic Sunrise in Italy to the beaches of Durban South Africa people all over the world have been showing their love for our eight-legged ocean friend that could be at risk of harm from deep sea mining. World leaders are gathering next week to decide on the future of the deep sea so it s time to make some noise and show them what s at stake if this dangerous industry is allowed to start. #StopDeepSeaMining

Caption: WANTED: Patrick Poyann  CEO of TotalEnergies is wanted for fuelling the climate crisis French activists from greenpeace_france unfolded a 100m2 gigantic banner at the TotalEnergies AGM while its chairman has announced an increase in oil and gas production over the next few years even though he knows well that fossil fuels are responsible for climate change. Scientists have been warning TotalEnergies about this catastrophe since early 1970s. Instead the company made almost 20 billion   in profits LAST YEAR ALONE by destroying the planet. This has to stop! We need a safe future for us all! #StopFossilGas #StopDrillingStartPaying #100ansdetrop

Caption: Over the past weekend more than 15.000 people across the Netherlands have taken to the streets for a powerful climate march in the financial heart of Amsterdam. Overflowing money bags. Screaming chainsaws. Unhinged bankers. And Heroic nature protectors. That was our opening act of the Climate March in Amsterdam in a nutshell.  Our message to the politicians was loud and clear: defund nature destruction NOW! So  Are we done now? No! You can help nature too. In June at the European elections. Nature is not for profit it s our future.   #UseYourVote   to protect our home  . Join us in demanding justice for our planet and people!  . . . . #DefundNatureDestruction #WeMakeTheFuture #nature

Caption: Did you know that most protected areas aren t actually protected at all? . Our new report From Commitment to Action: Achieving the 30X30 Target Through the Global Ocean Treaty shows only 0.9% of the global oceans are completely off limits to destructive human activities. . This means many precious marine ecosystems remain vulnerable to highly damaging fishing practices like bottom trawling and longlining  . The Global Ocean Treaty gives governments the power to create a network of global ocean sanctuaries that will help marine life recover and thrive - but it can only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have ratified it.  . If governments are serious about protecting at least 30% of the oceans by 2030 they MUST ratify the Treaty NOW.  Go to our LINK   IN BIO to sign the petition! . #ProtectTheOceans
Cleaned Caption: did you know that most protected areas aren t actually protected at all our new report from commitment to action achieving the 30x30 target through the global ocean treaty shows only 09 of the global oceans are completely off limits to destructive human activities this means many precious marine ecosystems remain vulnerable to highly damaging fishing practices like bottom trawling and longlining the global ocean treaty gives governments the power to create a network of global ocean sanctuaries that will help marine life recover and thrive but it can only come to life at sea once at least 60 governments have ratified it if governments are serious about protecting at least 30 of the oceans by 2030 they must ratify the treaty now go to our link in bio to sign the petition #protecttheoceans

Caption: BREAKING: Greenpeace International filed a landmark lawsuit in Dutch court against US-based fossil fuel pipeline company Energy Transfer today in the first test of the European Union s anti-SLAPP Directive.  #WeWillNotBeSilenced! Energy Transfer s meritless US$300 million suit against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace in the US is one of the world s most brazen examples of a Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation (SLAPP)   and we re fighting back!  Greenpeace Internationals lawsuit filed in Dutch court against Energy Transfer seeks to recover all damages and costs it has suffered as a result of this Big Oil company s back-to-back meritless lawsuits demanding hundreds of millions of dollars against GPI and the Greenpeace entities in the United States.  Check the link in our bio to let Energy Transfer and all Big Oil bullies know that #ImWithGreenpeace

Caption: Wherever they are we are! Activists with Greenpeace US and Greenpeace International took action against the deep sea mining industry near Toronto Canada. The company Impossible Metals is spreading greenwash pretending deep sea mining is sustainable and is necessary to save the planet. That is not true. Caption: We need your help! Greenpeace International activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the  Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia last year. ICYMI: On 30 November 2024 the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty.  Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea.  Sign your name via link in bio  #Greenpeace

Caption: While billionaires play their games   millions of people worldwide face climate catastrophe. Not only does Nigeria have to deal with the devastation fossil fuel companies left behind but now they face climate impacts caused by that same industry   Both Nigeria and Central Asia face extreme heatwaves due to climate chaos driven by the oil and gas industry. Floods in Australia DRC South Africa and US have claimed many lives and caused so much damage to peoples homes and communities   Who pays for this devastation? The science is clear: extreme weather is becoming more frequent and severe across the world.  And the fossil fuel industry is driving this climate chaos. Demand that fossil fuel corporations are forced to stop drilling and start paying for the climate damage they ve caused   (link in bio greenpeace) #stopdrillingstartpaying

Caption: Like Jay residents in the Lebung Itam Indonesia are facing the devastating impact of the smoke haze caused by peatland fires from nearby plantations   Jay lost his swiftlet (bird) house and his immediate environment turned toxic.  But Jay will not back down and his fellow villagers stand firm with him!  Together they have filed a lawsuit against three companies that are long-term wood suppliers to Indonesia s agribusiness and finance conglomerate Sinar Mas. It is a tale as old as time big conglomerates get away with it all according to greenpeaceID research despite government sanctions these devastating fires occur yearly  And so we join their fight for justice Take action today - share your message of #HopeForNature with world leaders at the UN Biodiversity COP16 and demand urgent action to protect the Amazon and our planet s future.  Watch the full video on YouTube to witness their powerful story!    Links in bio  #WorldOnFire #DefundNatureDestruction

Caption: greenpeaceth volunteers joined local medical volunteers to deliver emergency medical supplies to flood-affected residents in Phon Pisai district Nong Khai province in Thailand. The area submerged in flood due to heavy rains causing damages in crops farming and resident areas. Severe floods droughts extreme temperature and storms are a result of the climate crisis. These events are predicted to occur more frequently. Currently Thailand and many countries in different parts of the world are facing these extreme weather events.  Greenpeace is pushing for governments and industries to phase out fossil fuels to reduce the release of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere which is the main cause of the climate crisis. #ActOnClimate #PhaseOutCoal #StopCoalMine

Caption: The North Dakota Supreme Court today denied a petition by Greenpeace International and Greenpeace entities in the US for a change of venue as they defend against the SLAPP case brought by Energy Transfer in Morton County. The North Dakota Supreme Court s denial follows three prior denied motions to the Morton County court for change of venue.  The fairness of a trial should be above any questioning. A jury drawn from a community heavily affected by the events Energy Transfer is attempting to blame on the defendants shouldn t bear the responsibility of deciding this case. It s disappointing to learn the Supreme Court denied the motion but we are confident in our defence and will continue to focus on winning at trial said Daniel Simons Senior Legal Counsel Greenpeace International. Check the link in our bio to learn more about Big Oil bully Energy Transfer s SLAPP lawsuit. #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Caption: While northern China bakes under high temperatures compounded by drought cities across southern China are inundated by extended bouts of extreme rainfall. This year heavy rainfall and flooding has come from rainfall that is abnormally long in duration and wide range in terms of the area impacted. In an El Ni o year the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere is particularly high. Analysis from China s National Data Center shows that precipitation has been more than 20% higher than normal for the past ten days in most of southern China with some areas experiencing rainfall as high as twice the average. This year the amount of precipitation from April 4 to June 11 broke historical records for rainfall in southern China going back to 1961. The State General Administration of Flood Control initiated Level 4 Emergency Response for flood control in seven provinces including Fujian Guangxi Zhejiang Guizhou Guangdong Hunan and Jiangxi. There is no more time to waste. Photo: CFOTO/Future Publishing via Getty Images  #ActOnClimate #China #Flood #ClimateChange #Greenpeace

Caption: It s not a BIG secret that world leaders and fossil fuel lobbyists don t want you to know what s happening behind UN closed doors this week. That s why Greenpeacekorea is 10 stories up sending an even BIGGER message to governments on day 1 of Global #PlasticsTreaty negotiations: The world is watching YOU!  A strong Global Plastics Treaty is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to tackle the plastic crisis and we won t sit quietly while politicians trade away its ambition for fossil fuel profits! We demand a treaty that: Drastically cuts plastic production! Invests in reuse and refill targets! Drives a just transition that supports communities most impacted by the plastic crisis! Watch and share today to tell world leaders #WeAreWatching! The artwork was made in collaboration with artist and activist dan_acher ...#Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5

Caption: #HiddenGemsGeneration - In a world fixated on growth and productivity we often overlook what truly matters. GDP which has long been used as a measure of economic success fails to account for planetary health and human well-being contributing to the crises we face today. On 19 September 2024 ahead of Koreas Youth Day in Sinchon Seoul s vibrant youth district greenpeacekorea presented a striking visual demonstration. A 3-meter-high LED screen depicted a burning Earth while a 5-meter-long installation titled Invoice of GDP s Unaccounted Values stood in front. This action emphasized that GDP only measures economic quantity ignoring climate impacts and the well-being of people. #WellbeingEconomy #WellbeingForAll #GoBeyondGDP #YouthDayKorea

Caption: On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. This was a part of the  Sailing for Change: Plastic Free Future  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia. Fast forward over 3 months later the 4 activists and the Rainbow Warrior captain Hettie are still unable to leave the country and they continue to reside in Korea as they undergo their investigation for that peaceful direct action. Al - one of the activists - decided to pen her own story in her own voice from her own perspective. For Al s story of their journey check our link in bio.  #INC5Warriors #Greenpeace

Caption: This year the French multinational oil and gas giant TotalEnergies celebrates 100 years in operation.  PriceofOil Africa Senior Campaigner Charity Migwi looks at the true cost of its legacy in Africa #linkinbio The company s relentless pursuit of profit has come at the expense of Africa s most vulnerable communities and irreplaceable ecosystems. Total has a foothold in nearly 130 countries and operations that encompass the entire spectrum of the fossil energy sector from exploration to production refining to distribution.  Yet it s in Africa where TotalEnergies  actions have left some of the deepest scars.  #StopDrillingStartPaying #StopEACOP

Caption: Times are tough. Greenpeace is under attack and with it the global environmental movement and the pillar of free speech itself. But we won t back down. Protecting our common home cannot wait.Home is where we feel safe. For Indigenous peoples of the Amazon the forest is home. But in truth the Amazon is home to all of us one of our planet s life support systems.It holds 73 billion tons of carbon shielding us from climate chaos.When the Amazon thrives we all thrive. When it s under threat so is our future.Protect the forest protect our future.#RespectTheAmazon #ForestDay #InternationalDayofForests #IntlForestDay #ForestDay2025 #Amazon #Rainforest #ClimateCrisis #BiodiversityCrisis #ForestProtection #IndigenousPeoples #IndigenousRights

Caption: #WorldCarFreeDay In celebration of #MobilityWeek greenpeacekorea hosted a poster contest!  Over 100 participants shared their visions for sustainable transportation through creative graphic design. If youre in Seoul check out the top 3 winners creations at bus stops and subway stations until the end of this month! Through their artwork these citizen artists voiced their concerns about climate change and illustrated how we can all contribute to promote sustainable transportation options by using public transit and driving less. Learn more on what you can do to promote to #DriveChange - check link in bio.  #Transportation #ClimateChange #Seoul #Korea #Greenpeace

Caption: Ice cream vs Big Oil  It s getting REAL HOT out here. Under the scorching heat wave in Montreal Greenpeace Canada volunteers served out free vegan ice cream to help people cool down in the heat.Of course we had to name the flavours after Big Oil: dirty diesel drip gas guzzling twist climate crisis cream    After all they re the ones fuelling this crisis.In Canada nearly all provinces and one territory were under an extreme heat warning last week   Meanwhile people in Toronto experienced major floods and widespread power outages    Extreme weather events are no joke they endanger our health and livelihoods.  To truly cool down we need to hold fossil fuel companies accountable and make them pay for making the planet increasingly unliveable. While you cool off with an ice cream today (either with us or at home!) take a minute to sign our petition asking Big Oil to pay into a #ClimateRecovery fund >> LINK IN BIO!  They fuel these disasters they pay.

Caption: How much does recovering from extreme weather disasters cost? Last year a massive flood in Libya claimed 4000 lives with 8000 people still missing  On top of the massive loss of life and destruction of families and livelihoods it will cost USD 1.8 BILLION to repair the damage caused. This is just one of many extreme storms experienced globally in the past year   yet fossil fuel companies who are driving the #climatecrisis do not pay a cent for the loss and damaged they ve caused. Comment below if you fill big oil should be made to #PayUP  #StopDrillingStartPaying #MakePollutersPay

Caption: The reality of haze from forest fires may seem abstract to many. But to those in the front lines it s a frightening reality. Many of us endure urban fog from pollution we complain about it and we are keenly aware of its detriment to our livelihoods. But here s the difference: the haze in Porto Velho is the result of agribusiness practices running wild.You would think  How do they get away with it?!?! . Well they have a financial lifeline   Even those farms that get fined for deliberate fires still receive $12.5M in rural credit according to our research.   Somedo doesn t even get fined  Join us in sending a message of #HopeForNature   Click the link in our bio to learn more share Anders  story and stop this #WorldOnFire  #DefundNatureDestruction   outcastfilm_ StudioBirthplace rob_natali

Caption: Big Meat and Dairy are heating up the planet  A few days ago Greenpeace activists from many countries paid a visit to some of the world s biggest meat and dairy giants. These companies are major methane emitters accelerating climate chaos. Overproduction and overconsumption of meat and dairy are driving climate change polluting our soil air and water creating ocean dead zones and causing countless other problems. We can make a change!   By putting the brakes on Big Meat and Dairy corporations curbing their destructive factory farms and making a massive switch to more plant-based diets wherever possible we can slow down global heating within this decade. Tap the link in our bio to join us! #Meat #Dairy #StopFactoryFarming #ClimateCrisis #Methane #MakeMethaneVisible #PlantBased #Greenpeace
