Caption: ** Don t let Big Oil silence the climate movement. Back Greenpeace now. ** Around the world Big Oil is using lawsuits in an attempt to silence the climate movement.  Like Energy Transfer the company behind the Dakota Access Pipeline which is suing Greenpeace in the USA and Greenpeace International for US$300 million. If they win Greenpeace in the USA might have to shut its doors.  Energy Transfer s meritless lawsuit is an attack on free speech and peaceful protest. It s part of a concerted global attack by Big Oil which includes lawsuits from Big Oil corporations like ENI Shell and TotalEnergies.  We don t think Big Oil should get to control the climate movement do you? Back free speech. Back Greenpeace. Sign the open letter now. We Will Not Be Silenced. Share with a friend who doesnt like bullies. #ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Caption: Critical biodiversity negotiations ahead! Help us put pressure world leaders by sharing your message of #HopeForNature - LINK IN BIO  . The destruction of biodiversity is accelerating. Big Agribusiness industrial fishing fossil fuel extraction deep sea mining and corporate profits for the rich are threatening our planet and our life support system. . In just a few days critical UN Biodiversity COP16 negotiations will start in Cali Colombia. Let s make sure that global leaders around the world feel the pressure of our movement before and during this Biodiversity COP: join us by sending your message of #HopeForNature! . We will display your messages and images online and offline in photo and video projections in several regions around the world. We will also bring them to Cali Colombia where the negotiations will take place. . Tap the link in our bio . . . . #biodiversity #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis #defundnaturedestruction #CBD #COP16

Caption: We have bad news for corporate bullies like Energy Transfer: The European Union s new anti-SLAPP Directive helps put an end to abusive legal tactics used to silence people who speak out on matters of public interest Check the link in our bio to learn how Greenpeace International s fight against Energy Transfer s meritless lawsuit is a landmark first-ever application of the European Union s new anti-SLAPP directive.  #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Caption: Greenpeace International and Greenpeace entities in the US filed a petition to the North Dakota Supreme Court for a change of venue as they defend against the SLAPP case brought by Energy Transfer in Morton County North Dakota US. The Greenpeace defendants have said from the start of this case that it should be heard away from where the events happened. After three motions for a venue change were refused we now feel compelled to ask the Supreme Court of North Dakota to relieve the local community from the burden of this case and ensure the fairness of the trial cannot be questioned  - Daniel Simons Senior Legal Counsel Greenpeace International. Check the link in our bio to learn more about Big Oil bully Energy Transfer s SLAPP lawsuit. #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Caption: You may know Thailand as the country with good food and beautiful beaches but this country is also home to the Thai Mackerel an essential part of Thai cuisine and economy. This mighty fish has a multimillion dollar global demand but sadly overfishing and climate change are making its population die down. This June the Rainbow Warrior (Greenpeaceships) is sailing to Thailand to raise awareness about the threats facing the Thai oceans and to demand for a more urgent climate from the government.Stay tuned for more content on the Thai fishing industry and local coastal communities as the Rainbow Warrior goes on a ship tour around the country. And don t forget to follow us and GreenpeaceTH for updates!#Thailand #Oceans #OceanJustice #RainbowWarrior #Mackerel

Caption: Marginalised groups such as the LGBTQIA2S+ community are disproportionately impacted by the #climatecrisis.  Because of social stigma and lack of access to resources they are far less likely able to deal with climate impacts such as extreme weather events.  Here are 6 blogs explaining why there can be no #climatejustice without #queerjustice  #AfricanPrideMonth #PrideOfAfrica

Caption: Global ocean management is broken. Since fisheries management organisations (RFMOs) first appeared 70 years ago they ve repeatedly failed to protect the oceans. A new report from Greenpeace details how RFMOs have failed to meet their mandate for sustainably managing the impacts of fishing activity on biodiversity in international waters.  . The Global Ocean Treaty can deliver protection for all life in the global oceans. That s why governments must step up and put their words into action. They must urgently ratify the Treaty and create global ocean sanctuaries. Go to the link in our bio to add your name to the petition and #ProtectTheOceans!
Cleaned Caption: global ocean management is broken since fisheries management organisations rfmos first appeared 70 years ago they ve repeatedly failed to protect the oceans a new report from greenpeace details how rfmos have failed to meet their mandate for sustainably managing the impacts of fishing activity on biodiversity in international waters the global ocean treaty can deliver protection for all life in the global oceans that s why governments must step up and put their words into action they must urgently ratify the treaty and create global ocean sanctuaries go to the link in our bio to add your name to the petition and #protecttheoceans

Caption: The fifth (and almost final) round of Global #PlasticsTreaty negotiations in Busan South Korea wrapped last week. No treaty was adopted and talks will extend into 2025.  This is a quick and dirty of what you missed    100+ countries stood up to the fossil fuel industry to reject a weak treaty.  4 brave Greenpeace International activists protested on a vessel carrying TOXIC plastic chemicals to call out petrochem production in the treaty.  1500+ allies marched for a strong treaty that cuts plastic production.  Almost 3 million signature petition delivered to world leaders.  1 urgent message for world leaders: We demand a treaty that cuts plastic production in 2025!  . . . #Plastics #BreakFreeFromPlastic #ClimateCrisis #FossilFuels #EndOil #plasticpollution #realsolutions #plasticfree #zerowaste #Reuse #Refill #INC5

Caption: March is over but thats not stopping us from sharing more inspiring stories in honour of #women and their contributions in the fight for people and the planet! Today were celebrating the Feminist Macroeconomics Alliance of Malawi. They advocate for feminist economics that address pressing issues in their country including the #ClimateCrisis.  We re examining economies that center around wellbeing wellbeing for ourselves our society and our planet. Caption: Day 2 at the Fight for Alternatives Global Assembly in Manila: Youth Day! Youth activists from around the world are coming together to share workshop and brainstorm ideas for building a safe and just future with wellbeing at the core. We wanted to share some memorable quotes from Day 2 s speakers.  1. Erick National Front for 40 Hours Mexico  We need to be the owners of our present and our future and this is not only for the young people but for all the generations. We need to overcome taboos and prejudices. We need to raise awareness and empower our youth. The young people need to be aware of our society. The young people need to act. Rural areas are being marginalised opportunities are being taken away from the youth. We need to articulate the youth s struggle more. We understand that this would take years of action and we need older people to help us. We need to ensure a future for us all. 2. Daisy from HAWI - Gender Equality and Inclusion Kenya  For the youth we should conduct civic education. Educate them and let them know how to conduct advocacy practices on the issues that they have like unemployment and to hold politicians accountable. Guide them on which areas to go to which areas to learn from. 3. Sajida president of Sindhi Girls Student Tahreek Pakistan  We have to empower the marginalised youth. We need to mobilise them unite them educate them about what is happening to us what are the actual problems and how can we overcome them. Without uniting and empowering them we cannot get any proper solutions we cannot get any progress.

Caption: Human rights over bloody oil profits! This week five greenpeacenorge activists took peaceful action against Norwegian oil giant Equinor over its partnership with Ithaca Energy on the Rosebank oil field which is contributing to the illegal occupation of Palestine. Ithaca Energy is owned by Delek Group a company blacklisted by the UN for operating in Occupied Palestinian Territory. If Rosebank goes ahead profits from the oil field will contribute to the financing and expansion of illegal Israeli settlements on Palestinian land. The activists occupied the company s offices in Oslo for nine hours supported by a peaceful demo outside. Thousands of people have raised their voice against equinor s contribution to the bloody and illegal occupation. We call on the Norwegian government Equinor s majority-owner to ensure that Equinor respects human rights and international law.  Equinor must end the relationship with Ithaca and cancel Rosebank. Sign the petition now via link in bio greenpeace #equinorout #stoprosebank

Caption: Switching from Putin s gas to Trump s fracked gas doesn t solve Europe s energy needs it only deepens our dependence on harmful fossil fuels. Fracked gas from the U.S. can be even worse for the climate than coal and it comes with serious safety and health risks. Instead of keeping Europe hooked on fossil fuels the EU must lead the way into the renewable energy future ensuring fair energy prices and real energy security. Sign our open letter and demand a ban on all new fossil fuel projects. Let s invest in renewables reduce gas consumption and protect people and our planet.  Join us in signing our open letter demanding the EU stop fossil gas projects and protect our health and planet.   act.gp/stopfossilfuels  #StopFossilGas

Caption: Happy World Cities Day 2024!  This years theme is Youth Leading Climate and Local Action for Cities.  Last year at COP28 in Dubai young voices from the most climate-vulnerable regions took center stage offering groundbreaking perspectives that shaped the climate negotiations. Their inclusion in decision-making is crucial to achieving climate justice.  Now as we head into #COP29 we must continue to amplify the voices of those most affected and push for real accountability.  One powerful step? Make polluters pay!  It s time for those responsible for the climate crisis to bear the cost of its impact especially in cities where climate-vulnerable communities are on the frontlines. Act now and sign the petition via link in bio. #YouthForClimateAction #MakePollutersPay #WorldCitiesDay #ClimateJustice #Greenpeace

Caption: This past weekend greenpeace.southasia unfurled an exciting banner in the heart of Colombo to celebrate the commitment of the leadership of South Asian countries to #ProtectTheOceans. Recently Sri Lankas Cabinet of Ministers approved signing of the High Seas Treaty marking another milestone in the journey to get the Treaty ratified across the globe. Bangladesh and Maldives have already ratified the Treaty while India and Nepal have signed it. This shows commitment to creating waves of change for ocean protection in South Asia. Let s continue the fight and ensure a sustainable future for all marine life! #OceanProtection #MarineProtection #OceansForAll #HighSeasTreaty #SouthAsia #ClimateCrisis

Caption: We ve made so many major advances in technology over the years yet our smartphones and other gadgets are still manufactured with electricity from polluting fossil fuels?! . In a recent study by Greenpeace East Asia and cityuhongkong it found that over 218 million tonnes more emissions would be generated in 2030 if major manufacturers fail to achieve 100% renewable energy by then. That s more than the total emissions of the Netherlands! . Flooding storms and heatwaves are getting worse. As we all strive to save the planet its time for companies like Samsung UMC and Luxshare Precision to take responsibility and pledge to achieve 100% renewable energy by 2030. . Join us to urge these companies to make the right choice and sign the petition in the link in bio.  . . . #SupplyChange

Caption: The government of Porto Alegre (Brazil) didn t budget for flood protection and now the city is facing its biggest disaster in history..What if the budget had been made by the people as it used to be?In less than a year the region of Rio Grande do Sul has faced four major floods affecting millions of people. And when we look back we see that the policies needed to prevent adapt and respond to extreme events were left out of the plans.Participatory democracy which was once a reality in #PortoAlegre and an example to the world is all about ensuring that everyone has a voice in the management of resources directing them where they really matter. It s not just about coping with extreme events but also about defining policies that contribute to a fairer and more sustainable future so that people no longer live under a constant sense of fear and uncertainty. Change is possible and we can demand it. Join the fight for climate justice. : Vitor Rosa. Em menos de um ano o Rio Grande do Sul enfrentou quatro grandes enchentes afetando milh es de pessoas. E quando olhamos para tr s vemos que as pol ticas necess rias para preven o adapta o e resposta aos eventos extremos ficaram fora dos planos. A pergunta que ecoa  : e se as pessoas tivessem sido inclu das nas decis es do or amento municipal? Ser  que a hist ria seria diferente? A democracia participativa que j  foi uma realidade em Porto Alegre e exemplo para o mundo busca exatamente isso: garantir que todos tenham espa o de voz na gest o dos recursos direcionando-os para onde realmente importa. N o   apenas sobre enfrentar eventos extremos mas tamb m sobre definir pol ticas que contribuam para um futuro mais justo e sustent vel que fa a com que as pessoas deixem de viver sob uma sensa o constante de medo e . A mudan a   poss vel e a sociedade pode cobrar por isso. Some a sua voz   luta pela prote o ambiental.

Caption: The global fishing industry is a complex system of grocery stores seafood companies and fishing vessels that feels incredibly distant to most of us. But at the other end of the convoluted supply chain is another human being.  A person with hopes dreams a family friends...and according to mounting reports a person being exploited in order to provide seafood to supermarkets and restaurants worldwide.  Follow Firmans* journey from Indonesia to the Indian Ocean and the tuna he caught from ocean to plate. Caption: UN Biodiversity #COP16 is underway in Cali Colombia! In its first week delegates from 196 countries addressed several key issues for biodiversity and now at the halfway point we tell you whether the path so far is GREEN YELLOW or RED.  Among the issues the first week were countries action plans to protect 30% of their ecosystems financing for nature protection the synergy between climate urgency issues and efforts to conserve biodiversity ahead of the upcoming Climate COP and citizen participation. But #Cali also became the heart of the  #COP of the People  with the #GreenZone where forums and cultural activities are held reflecting the natural and cultural diversity of the region  . Go to the link in our bio to know more about our demands to global leaders at COP16!

Caption: They didn t see THIS coming   This week Greenpeace UK took the climate crisis to Shell s front door. Activists surrounded the oil giant s doorstep with once-cherished belongings which were wrecked when typhoons struck the Philippines. Ordinary people in the Philippines and beyond shouldn t be the ones paying to repair damage caused by the climate crisis when they did the least to cause it Big Oil companies who are making billions by fuelling climate change should be the ones footing the bill. Take action now to demand that Big Oil giants are made to pay for their climate damage - sign our huge people-powered petition. #Philippines #Typhoon #ClimateCrisis #ClimateChange #Shell #MakeShellPay #StopDrillingStartPaying

Caption: See you in court! Today a Dutch court ruled that Greenpeace Netherlands can proceed with their climate case against the Dutch State. In this climate lawsuit Greenpeace Netherlands is working together with the people of Dutch-Caribbean island Bonaire who are already facing the consequences of the climate crisis. Flooding and extreme heat impact peoples houses jobs and health yet the Dutch government has not done enough to protect them.  The case is now moving forward and it is high time!  The recently installed Dutch cabinet is scaling back on climate policy. That s why Greenpeace Netherlands and people of Bonaire are demanding the Dutch State to comply with its international commitments and human rights obligations by reducing CO2 emissions much faster and protecting citizens on Bonaire.  . . . #climatejustice #bonaire

Caption: We need your help! Our activists - Al Ash Jens Sam and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie - are currently prohibited from leaving South Korea. They are under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action that took place in Daesen city as a part of the  Zero Plastic Tour  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia. ICYMI: On 30 November the 4 activists boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex to deliver a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty.  Help us request for the legal processes to be completed quickly so our activists - #INC5Warriors - can rejoin their loved ones as soon as possible! Your signature will be delivered to the prosecutor and the judge overseeing our ongoing case in South Korea.  We re grateful for each and every one of your support. Add your name via link in bio. #Greenpeace

Caption: Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation (SLAPPs) are lawsuits that are filed with the intent to censor intimidate or silence critics by burdening them with the cost of a legal defence until they abandon their criticism or opposition.  For corporate bullies like Energy Transfer and Shell SLAPP lawsuits are about outspending opponents to intimidate them into silence. For Indigenous Peoples NGOs like Greenpeace International and class action communities fighting such SLAPP suits is about movement building in opposition to colonialist domineering and arrogant companies and their destructive projects whether in the energy sector agribusiness mining chemicals forestry etc. #WeWillNotBeSilenced  Check the link in or bio to learn more about about the global battle against SLAPPs and to share a message of solidarity

Caption: Greenpeace Will Not Back Down!  A major fossil fuel corporation is using a SLAPP lawsuit (Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation) to sue Greenpeace for over USD$660 million to pressure and silence environmental movements worldwide. This is an attack on freedom of expression and protest fundamental human rights.  But we will not give up!We will continue to speak the truth challenge the power that violates human rights and the environment and stand in solidarity with Greenpeace International and Greenpeace USA. We will not allow oil and gas corporations to use the law as a weapon to intimidate and destroy the fight for climate justice!This is not just Greenpeace s fight it s a fight for all of us. We call on fossil fuel corporations to stop attacking environmental defenders. Businesses must respect human rights and environmental rights. Share this post! Make your voice heard! Because the future of our planet depends on all of us!#WeWillNotBeSilenced #lawsuit #environment #sustainability #protest

Caption: INTRODUCING: the new and definitely-not-evil chatbot from Big Oil.  Since Big Oil wants to control what the climate movement can and can t say we asked it a few questions.  Ok we re joking. But Big Oil isn t. Around the world Big Oil is trying to censor environmental movements with lawsuits that bankrupt activists into silence. Lawsuits like the one Energy Transfer is currently taking out against Greenpeace International and Greenpeace in the USA for US$300 million. That s barely enough to make a dent in Energy Transfer s US$80 billion revenue. For us it s an attack that could threaten the future of Greenpeace in the USA.  We don t think that Big Oil has any business telling us what we are allowed to say. Do you? Back free speech. Back Greenpeace. Sign the open letter now. We Will Not Be Silenced. . . . . #ImWithGreenpeace #StopDrillingStartPaying #WeWillNotBeSilenced

Caption: Clean air is a human right. We deserve to live in a world where the air we breathe is not poisoning us and we deserve world leaders who take our health and well-being seriously.  The World Health Organization estimates that around 7 million premature deaths in 2023 were caused by air pollution and if we dont drastically reduce our carbon emissions soon this number is bound to get even higher. We need #CleanAirNow.

Caption: This joyful snow day video you re watching was filmed back in November during #INC5 in South Korea just days before our activists were detained then suspended from leaving the country for conducting a peaceful protest. ICYMI: On 30 November Al Ash Jens and Sam boarded a tanker that was about to load toxic plastic chemicals from South Korea s Hyundai Daesan Refinery complex.  As a part of the  Zero Plastic Tour  Rainbow Warrior ship tour in East Asia they were delivering a strong message to cut plastic pollution to the world leaders gathered at the nearby city of Busan for the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (#INC5) to negotiate a UN Global Plastics Treaty. And fast forward almost 2 months later the 4 activists and Rainbow Warrior Captain Hettie are still under an ongoing investigation for the peaceful direct action. With the follow-up negotiation meeting for the Global Plastics Treaty expected to be announced soon we are asking for your help for a quick conclusion of the investigation so our activists - our #INC5Warriors - can be reunited with their loved ones back home.  Add your name to our petition.  #Greenpeace

Caption: What if wealthy nations took responsibility for their own consumption and energy needs instead of dumping the social and environmental costs on the Global South?Today is #WorldDayOfSocialJustice and greenpeacear and MENAFem Movement for Economic Development and Ecological Justice are launching a report that challenges the common narrative around European investments in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. While these investments are often portrayed as mutually beneficial the reality is that they reinforce Europes exploitation of the Global South with harmful economic and environmental impacts on our communities.We must demand an end to harmful projects and together we can stop neo-colonialism in its tracks. Its time to stop the exploitation and stay united for a future that respects people and the planet.#europe #MENA #middleeast #northafrica #neocolonialism #energy #agriculture #bigoil #bigag #majorityworld

Caption: For young people across six countries Planet One has been more than just a project - it s been a life-changing journey of discovery action and leadership.From learning about climate change to sparking innovative solutions these youths have become powerful agents of change in the global movement for climate justice.  Get ready to experience their stories of transformation collaboration and action that have sparked a worldwide call to fight for a sustainable future.The full six minutes documentary is now live tap the link in our Instagram bio to watch it   Don t miss out on the impact these youths are making! Planet One is a partnership between fryshuset greenpeace and apy_ngo funded by postkodlotteriet  For more info on the makerspaces please visit:  alternative_youth_center Armenia  mboa.hub Cameroon  bolygo.hu Hungary  ubunifu.hub Kenya  ubuntu.hubsa South Africa  momentum.hub Sweden

Caption: hyundai s rising emissions in India and other key markets are fueling climate disaster according to a new report from Greenpeace East Asia.  During the first half of 2024 electric vehicles accounted for just one in 1000 vehicles sold by Hyundai-Kia in India.  Hyundai-Kia is on track to achieve carbon neutrality by the year 2280   more than two centuries later than the automaker s stated goal.hyundai must set ambitious emissions reduction targets for India and other markets. As one of the world s largest automakers Hyundai must take climate responsibility.#ClimateActionNow #DriveChange
